007package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
008
009import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
010
011/**
012 * A binary tree for detection. At each node of the tree, a test (feature) is done on the window. Depending on the
013 * result, either the left or right child of the node is selected and so on. When the process reaches a leaf, the
014 * corresponding value is returned.
015 */
016public class FeatureTree {
017        
018        //private final List<FeatureNode> nodes;
019        private final FeatureNode[] nodes;
020
021        FeatureTree(FeatureNode[] nodes) {
022                this.nodes = nodes;
023        }
024        
025        public FeatureNode[] getFeatures() {
026                return nodes;
027        }
028        
029        // evaluate the feature tree
030        double eval(IntegralImage II, int u, int v, double scale) {
031                FeatureNode feature = nodes[0]; // start at root of this tree
032                while (true) {
033                        // evaluate the current feature node to decide where to proceed:
034                        int dir = feature.eval(II, u, v, scale);
035                        // if the current node has a value for 'dir', return it:
036                        if (feature.hasValue(dir)) {
037                                return feature.getValue(dir);
038                        }
039                        // otherwise continue with the child node for 'dir'
040                        else {
041                                feature = nodes[feature.getChild(dir)];
042                        }
043                }
044        }
045
046
047        public void print() {
048                int featureCnt = 0;
049                for (FeatureNode node : nodes) {
050                        node.print(featureCnt);
051                        featureCnt++;
052                }
053        }
054
055}
